comments.html:
Nice trick! Thanks Ivan. A follow-up question would be:

Is it possible to somehow persist such setting, either for your current repo, or ideally as a global setting for .md files across all your repos? This is supposed to be a reasonable need, yet it seems more difficult than I thought. By any chance, have you ever figured that out already?
comments.name: Ray

comments.html:
Haven't found anything along those lines, but don't let that stop you. Git is open-source software, so you can either fork it or fix it and submit a patch.

See https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/SubmittingPatches for details.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
@Ray: found something usable ;) In .gitconfig:

[alias]
wdiff = diff --word-diff --word-diff-regex='\\w+'
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
Sorry, it escaped my characters. Trying again:

gitdf --word-diff-regex='\w+|\s+'
comments.name: Joseph W.

comments.html:
Sorry, my former command had an alias for it as well as some limitations. This one works:

git diff --word-diff-regex='\w+|[^[:space:]]'
comments.name: Joseph W.

comments.html:
Nice! Unfortunately this ignores non-word characters in the diff (see https://git-scm.com/docs/git-diff#Documentation/git-diff.txt---word-diff-regexregex). You can fix it using something like:

gitdf --word-diff-regex='\w+|\s+'
comments.name: Joseph W.
